event.title: was established as a municipality January 1, 1838

data.event: The parish of Tune was established as a municipality January 1, 1838 (see formannskapsdistrikt).
The rural district of Varteig was separated from Tune in 1861, and the same thing happened with Rolvsøy on 1 January 1911, leaving Tune with a population of 8,040.
The rural district of Varteig was separated from Tune in 1861, and the same thing happened with Rolvsøy on 1 January 1911, leaving Tune with a population of 8,040.

event.title: witnessed steady growth over the years

data.event: Despite the separations Tune witnessed steady growth over the years.

event.title: 1884, a series of border adjustments which moved

data.event: Starting in 1884, a series of border adjustments which moved territory from Tune to Sarpsborg took place.

event.title: 1884, parts with 696, 1,008, 66 and 10 inhabitants were moved

data.event: Following the moving of an uninhabited part of Tune to Sarpsborg in 1884, parts with 696, 1,008, 66 and 10 inhabitants were moved to Sarpsborg in 1912, 1925, 1957 and 1980 respectively.

event.title: 1 January 1992 the rest of Tune, along with Skjeberg and Varteig municipalities, was incorporated

data.event: On 1 January 1992 the rest of Tune, along with Skjeberg and Varteig municipalities, was incorporated into Sarpsborg.
